statement:
Let $S$ and $T$ be sets. If there are injections $S \to T$ and
$T \to S$, then there is a bijection $S\to T$.

The Schröder-Bernstein theorem is useful for proving many results about
cardinality, since it replaces one hard problem (finding a bijection
between $S$ and $T$) with two generally easier problems (finding two
injections).
